TITLE: Setting container environment variables in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining environment variables in a dev container using the containerEnv property. This approach sets environment variables at the container level so all processes in the container can access them.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"containerEnv": { "MY_VARIABLE": "${localEnv:MY_VARIABLE}" }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Image Metadata Structure for Development Containers
DESCRIPTION: JSON schema for storing development container metadata in image labels. Supports an array of configuration snippets that can be merged with local devcontainer.json files. Includes support for Features and container customizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
[
	{
		"id"?: string,
		"init"?: boolean,
		"privileged"?: boolean,
		"capAdd"?: string[],
		"securityOpt"?: string[],
		"entrypoint"?: string,
		"mounts"?: [],
		...
		"customizations"?: {
			...
		}
	},
	...
]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Features in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to specify Features in a devcontainer.json file. It includes examples of different ways to reference Features, including from OCI registries, HTTPS URIs, and local directories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"features": {
  "ghcr.io/user/repo/go": {},
  "ghcr.io/user/repo1/go:1": {},
  "ghcr.io/user/repo2/go:latest": {},
  "https://github.com/user/repo/releases/devcontainer-feature-go.tgz": { 
        "optionA": "value" 
  },
  "./myGoFeature": { 
        "optionA": true,
        "optionB": "hello",
        "version" : "1.0.0"
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dev Container Features in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of adding Features to a dev container using the features property. Features are reusable components that can be added to containers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"features": { "ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/github-cli": {} }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Overriding Feature installation order in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of explicitly setting the installation order of Features using the overrideFeatureInstallOrder property instead of relying on the default automatic ordering.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"overrideFeatureInstall–ûrder": [ "ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/common-utils", "ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/github-cli" ]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Feature Options in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define options for a Feature in the devcontainer-feature.json file, including type, description, proposals, and default value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "options": {
    "optionIdGoesHere": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Description of the option",
      "proposals": ["value1", "value2"],
      "default": "value1"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Feature Folder Structure
DESCRIPTION: Shows the required folder structure for a Dev Container Feature, including the mandatory devcontainer-feature.json and install.sh files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
+-- feature
|    +-- devcontainer-feature.json
|    +-- install.sh
|    +-- (other files)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Java Template Options Example in devcontainer-template.json
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a complete options configuration for a Java template with multiple configurable parameters including Java version, Node.js version, and Maven installation option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
// ...
"options": {
    "imageVariant": {
        "type": "string",
        "description": "Specify version of java.",
        "proposals": [
          "17-bullseye",
          "17-buster",
          "11-bullseye",
          "11-buster",
          "17",
          "11"
        ],
			  "default": "17-bullseye"
    },
    "nodeVersion": {
        "type": "string", 
        "proposals": [
          "latest",
          "16",
          "14",
          "10",
          "none"
        ],
        "default": "latest",
        "description": "Specify version of node, or 'none' to skip node installation."
    },
    "installMaven": {
        "type": "boolean", 
        "description": "Install Maven, a management tool for Java.",
        "default": "false"
    },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Parallel Lifecycle Scripts in DevContainer JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example configuration showing how to define multiple commands to run in parallel during container lifecycle stages. The configuration uses an object format where each key represents a unique command name and the value can be either a string or array command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/parallel-lifecycle-script-execution.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "postCreateCommand": {
    "server": "npm start",
    "db": ["mysql", "-u", "root", "-p", "my database"]
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Template Folder Structure Example
DESCRIPTION: Shows the required folder structure for a Dev Container Template, with the devcontainer-template.json at the root and the .devcontainer folder containing the devcontainer.json configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
+-- template
|   +-- devcontainer-template.json
|   +-- .devcontainer
|       +-- devcontainer.json
|       +-- (other files)
|   +-- (other files)
```

DESCRIPTION: Shows the file structure for a repository that contains multiple features. Each feature has its own directory with required files like devcontainer-feature.json and install.sh, along with an optional test directory structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features-distribution.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext

```
.
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dotnet

‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh

|   ‚îú
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ go
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-feature.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh
|   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-feature.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dotnet
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test.sh
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ go
‚îÇ   |   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test.sh
|   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test.sh
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Port Attributes in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring port forwarding attributes including label, protocol, auto-forwarding behavior, and local port requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "portsAttributes": {
    "80": {
      "label": "Web App",
      "protocol": "https",
      "onAutoForward": "openBrowser",
      "requireLocalPort": true,
      "elevateIfNeeded": false
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Secrets in Dev Container JSON Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to declare secrets in a dev container JSON configuration file. It includes examples of secrets with and without additional metadata.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/declarative-secrets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/base:bullseye",
    "secrets": {
        "CHAT_GPT_API_KEY": {
            "description": "I'm your super cool API key for ChatGPT.",
            "documentationUrl": "https://openai.com/api/"
        },
        "STABLE_DIFFUSION_API_KEY": {}
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Python Feature in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to reference and configure the Python Feature in a user's devcontainer.json file, overriding default options for version and pip installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"features": {
    "ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/python:1": {
        "version": "3.10",
        "pip": false
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Lifecycle Command Configuration in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining various lifecycle commands that execute at different stages of container creation and operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "initializeCommand": "yarn install",
  "onCreateCommand": ["yarn", "install"],
  "postCreateCommand": "bash scripts/install-dev-tools.sh",
  "waitFor": "updateContentCommand"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Hard Dependencies with dependsOn in Dev Container Feature
DESCRIPTION: Example of using dependsOn property in devcontainer-feature.json to specify required Feature dependencies with version constraints and options. Shows how to reference Features by version tag and SHA digest.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "name": "My Feature",
    "id": "myFeature",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "dependsOn": {
        "foo:1": {
            "flag": true
        },
        "bar:1.2.3": {},
        "baz@sha256:a4cdc44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855" {},
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring port attributes in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting port attributes for a specific port using the portsAttributes property. This allows adding labels and other metadata to forwarded ports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"portsAttributes": {"3000": {"label": "Application port"}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Feature Dependencies in JSON
DESCRIPTION: Example of a devcontainer-feature.json file with dependencies on four other published Features. The dependsOn property specifies the required features along with any options or version constraints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/feature-dependencies.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "name": "My Feature",
    "id": "myFeature",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "dependsOn": {
        "ghcr.io/second:1": {
            "flag": true
        },
        "features.azurecr.io/third:1": {},
        "features.azurecr.io/fourth:1.2.3": {},
        "features.azurecr.io/fifth@sha256:a4cdc44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855" {}
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Resolved Java Template devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the resulting devcontainer.json after the template options have been resolved with the user's selected values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
	"name": "Go",
	"image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/go:0-17-bullseye",
	"features": {
		"ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/node:1": {
			"version": "latest",
      "installMaven": "false"
		}
	},
	...
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Options Property Example in devcontainer-template.json
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the structure of the options property in devcontainer-template.json which defines configurable parameters that users can set when applying the template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "options": {
    "optionId": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Description of the option",
      "proposals": ["value1", "value2"],
      "default": "value1"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Generated from Feature Options
DESCRIPTION: Example of environment variables that are generated based on feature options, showing how defaults are applied for options not explicitly set by the user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: env
CODE:
```
VERSION="3.10"
PIP="false"
OPTIMIZE="true"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Option Parameters in devcontainer-feature.json for Python Feature
DESCRIPTION: Example of declaring option parameters for a Python Feature in the devcontainer-feature.json file, including version selection, pip installation, and optimization settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
// ...
"options": {
    "version": {
        "type": "string",
        "enum": ["latest", "3.10", "3.9", "3.8", "3.7", "3.6"],
        "default": "latest",
        "description": "Select a Python version to install."
    },
    "pip": {
        "type": "boolean",
        "default": true,
        "description": "Installs pip"
    },
    "optimize": {
        "type": "boolean",
        "default": true,
        "description": "Optimize python installation"
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting default port forwarding behavior in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining default behavior for ports not explicitly configured in portsAttributes using the otherPortsAttributes property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"otherPortsAttributes": {"onAutoForward": "silent"}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Lifecycle Commands in Feature JSON with Simple and Complex Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to define onCreateCommand, postCreateCommand, and postAttachCommand in a Feature's devcontainer-feature.json. Demonstrates both simple string commands and object-based syntax for parallel execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/features-contribute-lifecycle-scripts.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
{
   "id": "featureA",
   "version": "1.0.0",
   "onCreateCommand": "myOnCreate.sh && myOnCreate2.sh",
   "postCreateCommand": "myPostCreate.sh",
    "postAttachCommand": {
        "command01": "myPostAttach.sh arg01",
        "command02": "myPostAttach.sh arg02",
    },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Java Template devcontainer.json with Template Options
DESCRIPTION: Shows how template options are referenced in a devcontainer.json file using the ${templateOption:optionId} syntax for variable substitution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
	"name": "Java",
	"image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/java:0-${templateOption:imageVariant}",
	"features": {
		"ghcr.io/devcontainers/features/node:1": {
			"version": "${templateOption:nodeVersion}",
      "installMaven": "${templateOption:installMaven}"
		}
	},
//	...
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Host Requirements in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of specifying minimum CPU, memory, and storage requirements for a dev container using the hostRequirements property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "hostRequirements": {
    "cpus": 2,
    "memory": "4gb",
    "storage": "32gb"
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Feature Installation Script Using Environment Variables
DESCRIPTION: Example of a bash install.sh script that accesses environment variables generated from feature options to customize the installation process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features.md#2025-04-17_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "Version is $VERSION"
echo "Pip? $PIP"
echo "Optimize? $OPTIMIZE"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring VS Code-specific Properties in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to configure VS Code-specific properties in the devcontainer.json file using the 'customizations.vscode' property. This allows setting VS Code settings and extensions that should be installed inside the container when it is created.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/supporting-tools.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"customizations": {
		// Configure properties specific to VS Code.
		"vscode": {
			// Set *default* container specific settings.json values on container create.
			"settings": {},
			"extensions": [],
		}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Docker volume mounts in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example of adding additional mounts to a container using the mounts property, which accepts Docker CLI mount syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"mounts": [{ "source": "dind-var-lib-docker", "target": "/var/lib/docker", "type": "volume" }]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing Local Features in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to reference local Features in the devcontainer.json file using relative paths. The paths are provided using unix-style syntax and must point to subdirectories within the .devcontainer folder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features-distribution.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
{
        // ...
        "features": {
                "./localFeatureA": {},
                "./localFeatureB": {}
        }

}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: OptionalPaths Property Example in devcontainer-template.json
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define optionalPaths in a template configuration to specify files or directories that may be omitted when applying the template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "id": "cpp",
    "version": "3.0.0",
    "name": "C++",
    "description": "Develop C++ applications",
    "optionalPaths": [
         "GETTING-STARTED.md",                 // Single file
         "example-project-1/MyProject.csproj", // Single file in nested directory
         ".github/*"                           // Entire recursive contents of directory
     ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Docker-in-Docker Feature with Dev Container ID in JSONC
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the ${devcontainerId} in the mounts configuration of a Docker-in-Docker feature. It creates a unique volume for each dev container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-id-variable.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
{
    "id": "docker-in-docker",
    "version": "1.0.4",
    // ...
    "mounts": [
        {
            "source": "dind-var-lib-docker-${devcontainerId}",
            "target": "/var/lib/docker",
            "type": "volume"
        }
    ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring GitHub Codespaces Repository Permissions in devcontainer.json
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure repository permissions for GitHub Codespaces using the 'customizations.codespaces' property. This allows a codespace to access other repositories with specific permission levels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/supporting-tools.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
"customizations": {
	// Configure properties specific to Codespaces.
	"codespaces": {
		"repositories": {
			"my_org/my_repo": {
				"permissions": {
					"issues": "write"
				}
			}
		}
	}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Workspace Mount Configuration Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure workspace mounting with custom source and target paths
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainerjson-reference.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
"workspaceMount": "source=${localWorkspaceFolder}/sub-folder,target=/workspace,type=bind,consistency=cached", "workspaceFolder": "/workspace"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Project Structure for Local Features in Dev Containers
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the expected file structure for a project using locally referenced Features. Shows the directory hierarchy with two local Features inside the .devcontainer folder, each containing their required files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-features-distribution.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
.
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .devcontainer/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ localFeatureA/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-feature.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ localFeatureB/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-feature.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ install.sh
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Complete Devcontainer Configuration with Features and Lifecycle Hooks
DESCRIPTION: Sample devcontainer.json showing how to integrate multiple features with custom lifecycle commands. Demonstrates sequential and parallel command execution syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/features-contribute-lifecycle-scripts.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: jsonc
CODE:
```
{
    "image": "ubuntu",
    "features": {
        "featureA":  {},
        "featureB":  {},
    },
    "postCreateCommand":  "userPostCreate.sh",
    "postAttachCommand": {
        "server": "npm start",
        "db": ["mysql", "-u", "root", "-p", "my database"]
    },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: File Structure for Dev Container Templates
DESCRIPTION: Example directory structure for organizing multiple Dev Container Templates in a single repository. Each template has its own subdirectory with required files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-templates-distribution.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
.
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dotnet
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-template.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .devcontainer
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
|   ‚îú
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-from-docker
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ devcontainer-template.json
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .devcontainer

TITLE: Computing Unique Dev Container ID in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This function computes a unique identifier for a dev container based on its labels. It takes an object of labels, sorts them, creates a SHA-256 hash, and returns a base-32 encoded string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/devcontainers/spec/blob/main/docs/specs/devcontainer-id-variable.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const crypto = require('crypto');

function uniqueIdForLabels(idLabels) {
	const stringInput = JSON.stringify(idLabels, Object.keys(idLabels).sort()); // sort properties
